snippet: A report suggests that a program intended to help as many as four million troubled borrowers has allowed big banks to run roughshod over them again and again.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column highlights report on Home Affordable Modification Program indicating that only 887,001 borrowers, of potential 4 million, are taking part in program, and that banks have routinely rejected applicants; notes Christy L Romero, inspector general of Troubled Asset Relief Program and author of report, has pointed specifically to fact that Treasury Dept is not providing sufficient oversight of the mortgage reduction program.
lead_paragraph: A report suggests that a program intended to help as many as four million troubled borrowers has allowed big banks to run roughshod over them again and again.

headline.main: A Slack Lifeline for Drowning Homeowners
